name: Aba Shanti-I
description: One of the country’s most respected selectors and soundsmiths pumps out dub and roots.

name: Blackstar Showtime
description: This huge street-corner rig has a genre-spanning music policy.

name: Channel One
description: Mikey Dread and Jah T have been bringing reggae to this spot since 1979.

name: CMC Matrix
description: The home for all things D&B at Carnival: expect everything from jungle to jump-up.

name: Different Strokes
description: The Different Strokes crew promise a riotous mixture of hip hop, jungle and D&B, with help this year from bashment collective The Heatwave and Island Records. They’ve been holding down the St Luke’s spot for 21 years!

name: Disco Hustlers
description: As the name suggests, disco (and a healthy dollop of house) are on the menu here.

name: Disya Generation
description: What they lack in spelling smarts, this crew more than make up for in new- and old-school party tunes.

name: 4 Play
description: Expect underground UK talent, and fresh sounds alongside old-school anthems.

name: The Fun Bunch
description: They may be based on the edge of Carnival, but this team’s mix of R&B and garage always manages to set things off regardless.

name: Gaz’s Rockin’ Blues
description: A swinging, bluesy and rock ’n’ roll alternative to the bass business.

name: GI Roadshow
description: Peaceful reggae, soca and Latin vibes from this crew, led by DJ Megus.

name: Gladdy Wax Roadshow
description: A don of London’s reggae scene, Gladwin Wright boasts one of the world’s best reggae collections.

name: GT Flex/Mayhem Crew
description: UKG, party songs, dancehall and soca from the eight-man-deep crew.

name: High Grade
description: After some bass in your face? Then head to this classic reggae system.

name: I’Spy
description: The veteran crew bring reggae vibes to the old Good Times spot, which will be occupied from 2017 by Pineapple Tribe.

name: KCC and the Rocking Crew
description: A destination for funky US house fans since 1991.

name: Killer Watt
description: A haven for ragga and reggae fans. So Solid Crew’s MC Romeo and Megaman first appeared here as teenagers.

name: King Tubby’s
description: The legacy of one of Jamaican music’s most respected sound scientists continues. Head here for reggae and bashment.

name: Latin Rave Street Jam
description: Head here to bust out those sexy Latin dance moves you’ve been practicing.

name: Lord Gelly’s
description: The sounds of Jamaica, Grenada, New York and London in a W10 postcode.

name: Love TKO
description: As the name suggests, this is a sweet spot for fans of lovers rock, soul and soca.

name: Mangrove/Volcano Sound
description: This NHC soca institution is closely tied to its Trinidadian roots.

name: Mark Ross Soundsystem
description: Soulful house, funk and R&B jams by the Mark Ross Soundsystem.

name: Mastermind Roadshow
description: Long-time Carnival pleasers with plenty of upfront R&B and soul. Sadly John Humphrys still hasn’t put in a guest appearance.

name: Metro Glory
description: A simply gawp-inducing reggae system that pumps out some of the thickest, vinyl-based bass in the area.

name: Nasty Love Mixing Lab
description: The place to head for a fix of dirty, dirty dancehall.

name: Natural Dezire
description: They’ve changed their soundsystem name from Mellowtone for 2016, but Julie Henry and Marilyn Dennis are still spinning soul, ragga and R&B.

name: People’s Soundsystem
description: Following the passing of the legendary Daddy Vego, his son Dexter takes over this destination for all things Jamaican and reggae-related.

name: Platinum Soundsystem
description: Jungle, dancehall and reggae from selecter Simeon ’Dialect’ Dee, covering for the Arts-A-Light system this year.

name: Rampage
description: One of Carnival’s biggest systems returns after a year out, pumping out hip hop, R&B, dancehall and jungle.

name: Rapattack
description: The veteran Rapattack crew drop everything from ’70s funk jams and ’90s house classics right up to new R&B and hip hop joints.

name: Rough But Sweet
description: With their distinctive green speaker stack, RBS specialise in reggae, lovers rock and R&B.

name: Saxon Sound
description: Maxi Priest, Tippa Irie and Smiley Culture all cut their teeth on this pioneering system.

name: Sir Lloyd
description: Shy FX’s Party On The Moon once again brings big-name special guests to the Sir Lloyd soundsystem, established on this spot since ’79.

name: Sir Valdez
description: Hip hop and ragga beats from this veteran soundsystem.

name: Solution Sound
description: Sweet and melodic roots from this young crew who’ve taken on Jah Observer’s famed spot.

name: SSP Soundsystem
description: UK garage and soulful house is the order of the day here.

name: Virgo International
description: A family-friendly system busting out reggae and soca.
